concept_definition: A country in northeastern Europe on the eastern shore of the Baltic Sea; one of the three Baltic states, with capital Vilnius.
a country in Northern Europe on the eastern shore of the Baltic Sea; capital: Riga.
a country in Northern Europe on the eastern coast of the Baltic Sea, bordered by Latvia to the south and Russia to the east; capital: Tallinn.
a country in Central Europe, officially the Republic of Poland, bordered by Germany, Czech Republic, Slovakia, Ukraine, Belarus, Lithuania, and the Baltic Sea; capital: Warsaw.

a country in central Europe; officially the Federal Republic of Germany, bordered by Denmark, Poland, Czech Republic, Austria, Switzerland, France, Luxembourg, Belgium, and the Netherlands, with capital Berlin.
a country in Western Europe occupying most of the territory between the Mediterranean Sea and the English Channel; officially the French Republic, capital Paris.
a country in southwestern Europe occupying most of the Iberian Peninsula; capital city Madrid
A country in southern Europe whose capital city is Rome, located between the Mediterranean and Adriatic seas
a country in Eastern Europe and Northern Asia; the largest country in the world by area, officially called the Russian Federation
a country in northwestern Europe that occupies most of the central and southern part of the island of Great Britain; a constituent country of the United Kingdom, whose capital is London.

a country in North America comprising the United States of America; commonly used as a shortened form of "the United States" or to refer to the continents of North and South America collectively (the Americas) depending on context.
a country in North America occupying most of the northern part of the continent; a federation of ten provinces and three territories whose capital is Ottawa
Japan: a country in East Asia located in the northwest Pacific Ocean, consisting of an archipelago including the main islands Honshu, Hokkaido, Kyushu, and Shikoku; capital Tokyo.
A country in East Asia, officially the People’s Republic of China, which borders Russia, India, Southeast Asia, and is across a sea from Japan and the Philippines
a country in South Asia occupying the greater part of the Indian subcontinent; the Republic of India
a country in South America occupying much of the eastern part of the continent; the largest country in both South America and the Latin American region (officially the Federative Republic of Brazil).
a country and continent in the Southern Hemisphere comprising the Australian mainland, the island of Tasmania, and numerous smaller islands; capital: Canberra.
a country in northern Europe occupying the eastern part of the Scandinavian Peninsula; capital Stockholm.
a country in northern Europe occupying the western portion of the Scandinavian Peninsula; capital: Oslo.
a country in Northern Europe occupying the eastern part of the Scandinavian Peninsula, bordered by Sweden, Norway, and Russia, with Helsinki as its capital.
the capital and largest city of Poland, located on the Vistula River
Berlin: the capital city of Germany, located in northeastern Germany; a major cultural, political, and historical center.
the capital city of France; a major European cultural and political center
the capital city of the United Kingdom, located in southeastern England on the River Thames
the capital city of Italy, and ancient center of the Roman Empire
Madrid — the capital city of Spain, located in the center of the country; a major political, cultural, and economic center.
Moscow: the capital city of Russia, located on the Moskva River; the country’s political, economic, cultural, and scientific center.

a city in the U.S. state of New York; the largest city in the United States, located on the southeastern tip of New York State, known for its boroughs including Manhattan, cultural institutions, and as a global financial and cultural center.

a major city in the U.S. state of Illinois, located on the southwestern shore of Lake Michigan; the third-largest city in the United States, known for its architecture, cultural institutions, and economic significance.

a city in Southern California, United States; the largest city in California and the county seat of Los Angeles County, known for its entertainment industry, cultural diversity, and Mediterranean climate.
the capital city of Japan, located on the eastern coast of Honshu; a major political, economic, and cultural center
the capital city of the People’s Republic of China; a major political, cultural, and historical center in northern China.
the capital and largest city of Sweden, located on an archipelago where Lake Mälaren meets the Baltic Sea
the capital city of Norway, located in the southeastern part of the country on the Oslofjord
the capital city of Finland, located on the country’s southern coast on the shore of the Gulf of Finland
a particular position, point, or area in space; a location or site
a separate enclosed space within a building, typically used for a particular purpose (such as sleeping, living, or working)
a movable barrier used to close an opening in a wall, typically consisting of a panel that swings, slides, or folds to allow or prevent access to a room or building.
A large and densely populated urban area with significant administrative, commercial, and cultural institutions, typically governed by its own municipal government.
a nation with its own government, occupying a particular territory; a sovereign state
a politically organized territory with its own government and institutions; a country or nation-state
a region or part of a town, country, or the world that is distinct in some way; a measure of the extent of a surface or region (e.g., square units)
the solid part of the Earth's surface; ground or soil (especially as property or territory)
a wide way or strip of ground prepared and maintained for vehicles, pedestrians, or animals to travel on, usually connecting places and often paved or otherwise surfaced
a public road in a city or town, typically paved and lined with buildings, used for vehicles and pedestrians
a continuous vertical structure, usually of stone, brick, or other material, that encloses, separates, or supports an area or building
the direction or point on the horizon at 0° on a compass; the region or area that lies toward the North Pole from a given location
the direction toward the point of the horizon 90° clockwise from east; the cardinal point opposite north
the cardinal direction toward the point of the horizon where the sun rises; the eastern part of a region or country
the direction toward the point of the horizon where the sun sets; the cardinal point opposite east
the inner surface or area of something; the interior part or space within an object or structure
the external area beyond the boundaries of a building or structure; the outdoors
the area or part that is at the back of something; the rear or hind part (e.g., “she stood at the behind of the group”); the buttocks (informal)
the earth and all its inhabitants; a particular sphere of activity
a place of torment and punishment after death
a settlement larger than a village
a small settlement in a rural area
